name: Google Cast Overview and Android TV Code Lab
description:
We will be doing a brief overview of what is Google Cast, and a deep dive of Android TV. Be sure to have Android Studio installed and configured, and ready to learn about this new form factor of Android.

Teaser: Google Cast allows the developer to broadcast their content in new ways, such as pushing the webpage content that they are viewing to the TV. Another way of getting your content onto the screen is by developing for Android TV, which provides you the familiarity of the the Android SDK with additions of a few new apis. These apis enables your app to be responsive, and at the same time allows you to share a good portion of your business logic across the different platforms. One of the main differences between Android and Android TV is the interface.

To learn more please visit us during our monthly meetup.

name: Exploration of the new Android Runtime for ChromeOS (ARC)

venue.name: Switch InNEVation Center
venue.address_1: Switch InNEVation Center 6795 Edmond St 3rd Fl Las Vegas, NV 89118

description:
Exciting news! ¬†We have a great new meeting location that is being provided to us by Switch InNEVation Center (http://www.innevation.com/).

This month we’ll be exploring the Android Runtime for ChromeOS (ARC). ¬†It’s available in any Chrome Browser now as a Beta Extension (Get Started here).

Many of us use Chrome as our primary browser, many others also have Android phones. ¬†The purpose of (ARC-welder) is to bridge the gap from the Android phone over to the desktop, chromebooks, etc. ¬†It’s a new technology Google has been working on for a long time. It’s pretty amazing in that you may run Android apps now in your Chrome browser. ¬†Now that the beta is out, we’d love to talk about and play with it. ¬†You may play games built for Android on your Chrome browser, or another app you cannot let go and it’s a must have when you switch to a Desktop.

Please come join us for an interactive session on this new technology called Google ARC. ¬†Everyone is welcome as always.

What do you need to join in? ¬†A laptop! ¬†Don’t have Chrome installed? ¬†No worries, we’ll help! ¬†Simply show up and we’ll be happy to help you get started in playing with the ARC-Welder Extension for Chrome.

We will continue to cover this new technology as it evolves in future meetups.

Looking forward to seeing you all here!
how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the third floor, and follow the signs.

name: Chromecast - Bringing Web Content to the Big Screen with Google Cast

venue.name: The Westin Lake Las Vegas Resort

description:
Hello Everyone,

This coming May we will be meeting at the beautiful Westin Lake Las Vegas Resort.

Our topic will be covered by an awesome guest speaker Kevin Nilson. Kevin Nilson is the Team Lead of the Chromecast Technical Solutions Engineer team, a Java Champion and three time JavaOne Rock Star Presenter. Kevin has spoken at conferences such as JavaOne, Devoxx, JAX, O'Reilly Fluent, Silicon Valley Code Camp, JAX, HTML5DevConf, On Android, NFJS SpringOne and AjaxWorld. Kevin is the co-author of Web 2.0 Fundamentals. In the past Kevin was an adjunct professor at the College of San Mateo. Kevin holds a MS and BS in Computer Science from Southern Illinois University. Kevin is the leader of the Silicon Valley JavaScript Meetup, Silicon Valley Java User Group, Silicon Valley Google Developer Group, and Devoxx4Kids Bay Area.

Have you ever wanted to expand your web app to enable a multi-screen experience leveraging large display devices like a television? Google Cast allows you to share content with a Google Cast receiver device, such as a Chromecast. Google Cast web senders use the familiar controls of your desktop browser to control the experience of your application on the big screen. In this talk, Googler Kevin Nilson will talk about Chrome Sender App Development and HTML5/JavaScript Receiver Development. Kevin will also cover some of the best practices to keep your Cast experience simple, intuitive, and predictable.
how_to_find_us: Signs will be posted at the resort. It will be in Rabat A.

name: GDG Study Jam: Android for Beginners - Session 1 of 5
description:
Come join us for GDG Study Jam, a community organized study group around the Udacity Android for Beginners course. This will provide a group setting to get started with Android development.

The Study Jam consists of five (5) 2 hour sessions spread over 5 weeks. In each session we'll go over online course material together with room for questions and assistance. The course consists of 3 lessons with 2 practice sets, and a final project.

What's in it for you?

•¬†Personal tutoring on the course material

•¬†Community setting to support course learning

•¬†Google offered Study Jams completion certificate¬†

•¬†Discount on Android Nanodegree upon course completion¬†

•¬†Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app

• Learning something new!

Please register at the following link prior to your arrival at the Study Jam - ¬†Udacity Study Jams

Once you go to the link above you will need to register for a Udacity account in order to keep track of your progress. The course materials are FREE and you do not need to sign up for a trial, despite how it looks on the course page.

PLEASE NOTE: you DO NOT need any prior programming knowledge to participate in this Study Jam!

name: GDG Study Jam: Android for Beginners - Session 3 of 5
description:
Come join us for GDG Study Jam, a community organized study group around the Udacity Android for Beginners course. This will provide a group setting to get started with Android development.

In session 3 we will be covering Lesson 2A in the Android for Beginners course. If you would still like to join the study jam you will want to complete Lesson 1A, 1B & Practice Set 1 on your own. That will catch you up to what we will be covering in session 3.

Make sure to bring your laptop with Android Studio & the JDK installed (you will have this once you complete Practice Set 1) since most of Lesson 2A requires you to have installed both.

name: Never enough Android: Android Auto in your car
description:
Come see Mark Scheel give an abbreviated version of his Android Auto talk from Droidcon SF (past) and AnDevCon Boston (future) in Las Vegas. Will cover how you too can get Android Auto (post I/O it is easier than ever!), what the user experience is like, and some coding overview for media apps. Will highlight all the latest and greatest news that came out of Google I/O this May 2016.

Mark will be in from Colorado where he trail runs, snowboards and enjoys long city to slope commutes thanks to Android Auto. He has given talks at AnDevCon, Droidcon, Big Android BBQ, Denver Startup Week and other events around America. ¬†Mark has also given a keynote in Paris, and a seminar in Hong Kong and published a book on Google Glass. He recently found a bass and won a ticket to #io17, but most days a consumer medical app with 7 million+ Play Store downloads is his 9-5 passion.

Hop Nuts Brewing¬†will be providing a limited amount of beer for the event, so make sure to get there early if you would like some!¬†

name: The New Firebase
description:
Come hear Abe Haskins talk about the new Firebase and how it can help you develop high-quality apps, grow your user base and earn more money whether your app is on iOS, Android, the web or everything!

Abe Haskins is a engineer for Firebase at Google and has been a Firebase developer for a long time. Prior to joining the team at Google he ran a Firebase-focused consulting company. He spends his days working with people who build great things on Firebase and building open-source Firebase tooling to help them.

Hop Nuts Brewing¬†will be providing a limited amount of beer for the event, so make sure to arrive on time if you'd like some!
how_to_find_us: Located on the corner of S Casino Center Blvd & Charleston Blvd

name: Introduction to Progressive Web Apps (PWA)
description:
Progressive Web Apps are a new technology to bridge web apps with mobile apps. Introduced by Google Chrome and a core part of Angular 2, it helps users move from a great web experience to a great mobile experience seamlessly.

We'll begin with a presentation covering the core technology, we'll watch the keynote recorded at the Progressive Web Apps Dev Summit in Amsterdam, and finish up with hands-on code labs building a PWA.

Agenda

•¬†PWA Technology Introduction

•¬†Keynote Video: PWA Dev Summit (Amsterdam, NL)

•¬†Hands-On Code Labs: Build a PWA

https://youtu.be/uHgqWg3OIIo?list=PLNYkxOF6rcIAWWNR_Q6eLPhsyx6VvYjVb

Learn how to build great web experiences that load quickly and are amazing to use in every browser and then how to weave in the latest platform technologies to deliver a great Progressive Web App.

Speaker

Terence Carroll is a Software Engineer that strives to build beautiful things but limited by his "programmer art". He is fascinated watching designers making pretty things. Past work includes tiny startups and giant enterprises, and he built technology acquired by Expedia. Smart enough to realize teamwork is the foundation of success. Lucky enough to work with talented friends. Loves AngularJS, Ionic Framework, C#, iOS, and Android. Misses C/C++.

name: Angular 2
description:
Interested in learning Angular 2? Let's learn Angular directly from the team at¬†Google!

I'm excited to announce that Jules Kremer, Developer Relations at Google and Stephen Fluin, Developer Advocate at Google will speak at our Angular meetup and #VegasTech. You may recognize Jules and Stephen from Angular keynotes at¬†Google IO,¬†ngConf, and¬†AngularConnect. We are very forunate that they were able to step away from a busy conference schedule to visit #DTLV.

Jules Kremer
Developer Relations at Google

Jules is a TPM on the Angular team. When not working with developers, Jules is often bending into pretzel-like shapes, climbing mountains or drinking really awesome beer.

Stephen Fluin
Developer Advocate at Google

Stephen is a Developer Advocate on the Angular Team at Google. Stephen works to solve real world problems faced by developers and businesses, and to represent the needs of the community within the Angular team.

Pizza is generously donated by the iovation team.

This meetup is presented in partnership with:
•¬†Las Vegas Developers
•¬†VegasJS
• AngularJS Las Vegas
•¬†#VegasTech

name: Android Meet & Greet
description:
Are you an Android developer or someone who is interested in Android? Come join other like-minded people in the Las Vegas community to talk about what you're working on, interested in, or want to learn more about in the Android world.¬†

Join us at the Teamvvork Co-working space located next to Makers & Finders and Hop Nuts Brewing in Downtown Las Vegas to share some free beer and chat about Android. This will be an informal meet & greet to discuss Android topics that you're interested in and share your work, as well as meet others in the Las Vegas Android community.

Hope to see you there!
how_to_find_us: Next door to Makers & Finders and Hop Nuts

name: Hands-On Angular 2
description:
We're going to watch a video presentation on Angular 2. There is a companion code lab and we will follow along.

Great way for beginners to get started with Angular 2.

name: Introduction to Kotlin, a language for Front-end, Back-end, and Android
description:
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that you can use in front-end, back-end, and Android development. The best part is, it’s 100% interoperable with Java and works with Javascript! With a modern language called Kotlin, you can do it right - faster - and with less bugs!

In this talk, Matt Runo will go over what you need to know to dive into your first Kotlin project.. syntax, basic structure, and how to not be lost when you’re listening to a more advanced discussion of Kotlin’s features. You don’t need to know Java, but some familiarity with object oriented languages will help you follow along with this short introduction to the Kotlin language. Swag included.

Matt Runo is a software engineer currently working for American Express. He has over 6 years of experience developing Android apps and web services for Zappos.com, Tinder and SHIFT. Matt enjoys both the technical challenges presented by resource constrained systems like Android, as well as the art of creating beautiful UIs that are intuitive and a joy to use. When not coding, he enjoys flying, getting lost in Wikipedia, and long walks on the beach.

name: Google I/O Recap
description:
Come hang out and enjoy some free food & drinks while Matt Kranzler and Terence Carroll provide a recap of what happened at Google I/O.

We will talk about new product announcements, updates to existing products and answer any questions you may have about Google I/O 2017.

name: Programming your Google Home, GCP & more - with Mark Scheel from Colorado
description:
Mark Scheel, organizer of GDG Denver and speaker at next week's 360|AnDev in Colorado is in town for one night en route to the AT&T Shape Hackathon in Los Angeles.

He will have his Google Home programming rig including a Rapberry Pi based version of Google Home.

Learn how to create interactive voice experiences with API.AI, Google Cloud functions, and how to make your own Google Home for about $50 in parts. Join us as we dive into Actions on Google and talk about the Actions on Google Challenge which can win you a ticket to Google I/O 2017! Be part of the conversation about AIY Projects: AI for Makers. And more!

We will be giving away a ticket on behalf of GDG Las Vegas to 360|AnDev in Denver, CO July 13-14, 2017 at this event.

Mark Scheel is an Android programmer in Denver, CO. He is president of Digital Construction, Inc.

name: Make Great UIs with Material Design
description:
Learn about Material Design from Google. Material Design is a design framework and code libraries to create outstanding user interfaces.

You'll get an overview of Material Design with resources for Web, Android, and iOS. Quickly build amazing user interfaces without struggling to build cross-platform user-interface components.

Pizza at 6pm and presentation at 6:30pm.

name: Angular 4 HTTP Interceptors: There and Back Again
description:
Angular 4.3 introduced a new HTTP client library and brought back a beloved feature from AngularJS: Interceptors.

In the words of the Angular team: "When your application makes a request, interceptors transform it before sending it to the server, and the interceptors can transform the response on its way back before your application sees it." In this presentation, you will learn to create HTTP Interceptors with Angular 4.3+, use cases for Interceptors, and probably the most common case; authentication and authorization. Learn additional best practices, tips and tricks using the new HttpClient library.

Speaker: Ado Kukic @kukicado

Ado Kukic is a full-stack developer and developer evangelist at Auth0. Mixing his passion of programming and education, he creates tutorials, courses, and other educational content focusing on security, authentication, and much more. On the front-end, he prefers Angular, while on the backend he flip-flops between Node.js and Golang.

name: Real World Serverless Apps with Angular and Node
description:
Workshop on Angular and Serverless Node with Chris Sevilleja and Ado Kukic.¬†Serverless applications are all the rage these days. Can they be used to build real world applications? We'll build a GIF battle site using a Node serverless API and consuming the API with Angular.

Learn best practices, tips & tricks from the founders of Scotch.io. We'll have pizza, Chris and Ado will bring the code.

You will learn:

•¬†How to build an awesome front-end client with Angular
•¬†Why serverless is useful
•¬†How to build a serverless API

Bring your computer to code along!

Chris Sevilleja @chrisoncode

Chris is a well-rounded developer and designer and founder of web dev tutorial site, Scotch.io. His Angular passion resulted in many courses on Angular development's best practices.

Apart from writing countless tutorials on Angular, Chris co-authored recently a book: "MEAN Machine - The beginner’s guide to the JavaScript stack". His main focus is on teaching how to build scalable and well-structured Node/Express applications and RESTful APIs from scratch using dynamic Angular front-end.

Taking complex topics and simplifying them to their core is his driving mission. He focuses on teaching web development topics and making real-world apps.

Ado Kukic @kukicado

Ado is a full-stack developer and developer evangelist at Auth0. Mixing his passion of programming and education, he creates tutorials, courses, and other educational content focusing on security, authentication, and much more. On the front-end, he prefers Angular, while on the backend he flip-flops between Node.js and Golang.

name: GDG Holiday Party
description: Come celebrate the year with us at the 2017 GDG Holiday Party! This will be an informal event where you will have the opportunity to socialize with other developers and chat about Google technology. FREE food & drinks will be provided! We also will be having some prize giveaways for those in attendance. We hope to see you there!

name: Kubernetes with Googler Kelsey Hightower

venue.name: Switch InNEVation Center
venue.address_1: Switch InNEVation Center 6795 Edmond St 3rd Fl Las Vegas, NV 89118

description:
• What we'll do
Join us to kick off 2018 with a visit from Kelsey Hightower! We're very excited to have Kelsey back for another visit. A Staff Developer Advocate for Kubernetes at Google, and a friend to literally everyone in the Kubernetes community, Kelsey's also the guy who wrote the book "Kubernetes Up and Running" (along with Joe Beda and Brendan Burns). He's regarded by many as the face of the Kubernetes community, and once you come hear him speak, you'll know why. This is a great opportunity for both new and existing members. If you're looking to bring new people in to the community, I can't think of a better person to come meet and to hear speak. If you'd like to see what he's about beforehand, you can check out his twitter feed at https://twitter.com/kelseyhightower

At 6pm, there will be a brief introduction of what's happened over the past couple months in Kubernetes, followed by Kelsey taking the stage. Bring your questions, bring your comments, bring your coworkers, and bring your sense of community!

Infosiftr will be providing pizza and drinks, so RSVP to make sure we have an accurate count.

We'll also have several free copies available of the sample chapters of Kelsey's book, courtesy of our friends at Heptio, as well as a bucket of swag left over from Kubecon. Leave with more Kubernetes stuff than you came with!

I hope to see many of you there on January 18th!

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Google Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: PunchCode
venue.address_1: 1112 S Casino Center Blvd, Las Vegas, NV, us

description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
6:00pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
7:30pm: Break
8:00pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
9:00pm: Event ends

• What to bring
Laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)

• Important to know
Food & drinks will be provided!
how_to_find_us: This is the same building The Iron Yard used to be in

name: Angular: Intro to RxJS
description:
üìΩ Chris and Ado are back to talk about RxJS. üíª We'll order pizza! üçï

Intro to RxJS

Presenters: Chris Sevilleja and Ado Kukic
Description: I'm sure you've heard functional, reactive programming and RxJS thrown around, but if you're like most developers, these terms don't mean much to you. In this introductory talk, we'll explain what functional, reactive programming is, how it pertains to Angular (hint: you're probably already writing reactive code) and how it can make your applications better. We'll also compare and contrast reactive programming patterns to the more traditional ways of writing JavaScript.

name: Build beautiful native apps in record time - Intro to Flutter with Donn Felker

venue.name: PunchCode
venue.address_1: 1112 S Casino Center Blvd, Las Vegas, NV, us

description:
Flutter is a new SDK and framework from Google that facilitates cross-platform development with ease. With Flutter, you'll write your applications in Dart, a programming language from Google. No need to fret though - if you have familiarity with Java, JavaScript or C# style of languages you'll feel right at home. Flutter's framework is heavily influenced by React and this makes declaring and programming applications quick and easy. In this session we'll build a Flutter application from the ground up which targets both Android and iOS, all through Android Studio.

Donn Felker is a independent consultant who has written multiple books on Android Development. He's an Android GDE, the co-host of the Fragmented Podcast (a Podcast for Android Developers), the curator of the Android Dev Digest - a weekly newsletter for Android Developers, and he's the founder of Caster.IO - a technology education site for developers. He's shipped multiple award winning applications over the years and you can now find him working with various technologies like Android, Flutter, React Native and web development and most recently - Blockchain Development. Follow him on twitter and Instagram at @donnfelker or check out his blog at donnfelker.com

name: Programming Google Home - A Build Actions for your Community event #BAFYC

venue.name: PunchCode
venue.address_1: 1112 S Casino Center Blvd, Las Vegas, NV, us

description:
Hey Las Vegas! Got a Google Home? Want to learn how to program a Google Home? Want to maybe walk away with a Google Home Mini?

Come on out for a presentation by Google Developer Group Denver Organizer Mark Scheel covering Actions on Google programming.

Bring your laptop (optional) and be prepared to leave with all the tools you need to make an amazing voice interaction for yourself, your business or the world.

Also, we will have pizza so please make sure to arrive on time if you would like some!

Mark has covered this topic before, recently at Droidcon Toronto in Canada (see event photo), and has spoken about other Google Developer topics in Paris, Hong Kong and major American cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles and Boston.

We're excited to have you, please tell your friends!

This is an official "Build Actions for Your Community" event. If you develop an action be sure to include BAFYC in the name for potential extra promotion from Google. More on this at the event!

name: Testing Mobile Apps the Easy Way

venue.name: PunchCode
venue.address_1: 1112 S Casino Center Blvd, Las Vegas, NV, us

description:
Firebase Test Lab isn’t just for Android - Test Lab supports iOS tests now as well! You don’t even need to learn a whole new SDK like Espresso to take advantage of test lab tests - using a tool called Robo you can get a lot of value and assurance before launching updates to your app without much, if any, work on your part.

Matthew Runo is a Senior Engineer at American Express where he leads the development of the Amex Mobile application for Android.

Pizza will be provided!

name: An Evening with Kelsey Hightower

venue.name: Switch InNEVation Center
venue.address_1: Switch InNEVation Center 6795 Edmond St 3rd Fl Las Vegas, NV 89118

description:
Help us kick off 2019 with a visit from our dear friend, Kelsey Hightower, Staff Developer Advocate from Google!

We'll do the best thing we can possibly do: Give Kelsey the stage and let him go. Will he do a live demo? Maybe. Will he bring friends for a conversation? Who knows. Will he juggle? Probably not.

We'll have swag, food, and giveaways for everyone, too.

More details to come!
